meanings.sent1: She worked hard to succeed in her exams.
meanings.sent2: With determination, you can succeed in anything you set your mind to.
meanings.sent3: The little ant tried to succeed in carrying the heavy crumb, but it was too big for her.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude helped him succeed where others had failed.
meanings.sent5: The seed needs sunlight and water to succeed in growing into a plant.

meanings.definition: Follow or replace someone or something in a particular role or position.
meanings.sent1: After the retirement of the old manager, a new one will succeed him.
meanings.sent2: The young athlete hopes to succeed the current record holder in the upcoming competition.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel planned to succeed the cat as the ruler of the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The apprentice was eager to succeed his mentor and take over the business one day.
meanings.sent5: The rising star is ready to succeed the veteran actor in the lead role of the play.
